commits.message:
Added route and path tags to Sentry admin events (#18781)

no issue

- All events sent from Admin should now be tagged with the current route
(e.g. `lexical-editor.edit`) and the path (e.g.
`editor/post/65388d98734d6ecc7bbafb87?test`)
- This will allow us to filter events by route and path in Sentry and
improve our alerting logic

pull_request.title: Added route and path tags to Sentry admin events

no issue

- This will allow us to filter events by route and path in Sentry and improve our alerting logic

commits.message:
Enabled Sentry Debug integration for Admin when in development mode (#18780)

no issue

- This change enables the Debug integration in Sentry when the app is
running in development mode (and Sentry is configured with a valid DSN).
- Whenever an event is sent to Sentry, the event & hint are passed to
the beforeSend() function will be logged to the browser console so you
can quickly see a) when events are sent to Sentry and b) exactly what
data & tags are sent with integration

pull_request.title: Enabled Sentry Debug integration for Admin when in development mode
pull_request.body:
no issue

- This change enables the Debug integration in Sentry when the app is running in development mode (and Sentry is configured with a valid DSN).
- Whenever an event is sent to Sentry, the event & hint are passed to the beforeSend() function will be logged to the browser console so you can quickly see a) when events are sent to Sentry and b) exactly what data & tags are sent with integration

commits.message:
Removed RewriteFrames integration from Sentry (#18779)

no issue

- Unfortunately the RewriteFrames plugin was not successful in fixing
the duplicated `/assets/assets` in the Sentry stacktraces for admin
- This commit removes the RewriteFrames plugin and reverts the changes
so there will at least be some kind of source code reaching Sentry

commits.message:
Fixed duplicate `/assets` in Sentry stacktrace filenames (#18777)

no issue

- For whatever reason, our Sentry stack traces are adding an extra
`/assets` to the filenames in stacktraces from admin
- Attempted to fix this
[here](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost/commit/3e9ee16ffb87bcf8e98c89a3213f8785fb8c19c0)
but it didn't work because at this point the duplication hasn't occurred
yet
- This change strips the `/assets` segment from the filenames, so when
Sentry adds it back in, it doesn't duplicate anything. Would be good to
get to the bottom of why this is happening, but this should hopefully
improve our stacktraces in Sentry in the meantime.

pull_request.title: Fixed duplicate `/assets` in Sentry stacktrace filenames
pull_request.body:
no issue

- For whatever reason, our Sentry stack traces are adding an extra `/assets` to the filenames in stacktraces from admin
- Attempted to fix this [here](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost/commit/3e9ee16ffb87bcf8e98c89a3213f8785fb8c19c0) but it didn't work because at this point the duplication hasn't occurred yet
- This change strips the `/assets` segment from the filenames, so when Sentry adds it back in, it doesn't duplicate anything. Would be good to get to the bottom of why this is happening, but this should hopefully improve our stacktraces in Sentry in the meantime.

issue.title: Redirecting `/` causes infinite loop

labels.name: needs:triage
labels.description: [triage] this needs to be triaged by the Ghost team

issue.body:
### Issue Summary

Uploading a `redirects.yaml` containing

```
302:
  # temp landing page
  /: /welcome
```

causes site frontpage to redirect to an infinite loop of `/welcome/welcome/welcome/`etc.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create `redirects.yaml` containing:
```
302:
  # temp landing page
  /: /welcome
```
2. Upload to Redirects in `/ghost/#/settings` Labs.
3. Visit site root domain.

### Ghost Version

5.70.2+moya

### Node.js Version

Ghost(Pro) Stable

### How did you install Ghost?

Hosted on Ghost(Pro)

### Database type

MySQL 5.7

### Browser & OS version

Safari 17.1 on macOS 14.1

### Relevant log / error output

```shell
Browser error: too many redirects (eventually)
```


### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to be friendly and polite to people in this repository

comment.body: Use case: we are trying to put up a temporary landing page (`/welcome/`) directing visitors to a Kickstarter before we launch and start regular posts.

issue.title: Redirecting `/` causes infinite loop
issue.body:
### Issue Summary

Uploading a `redirects.yaml` containing

```
302:
  # temp landing page
  /: /welcome
```

causes site frontpage to redirect to an infinite loop of `/welcome/welcome/welcome/`etc.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create `redirects.yaml` containing:
```
302:
  # temp landing page
  /: /welcome
```
2. Upload to Redirects in `/ghost/#/settings` Labs.
3. Visit site root domain.

### Ghost Version

5.70.2+moya

### Node.js Version

Ghost(Pro) Stable

### How did you install Ghost?

Hosted on Ghost(Pro)

### Database type

MySQL 5.7

### Browser & OS version

Safari 17.1 on macOS 14.1

### Relevant log / error output

```shell
Browser error: too many redirects (eventually)
```


### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to be friendly and polite to people in this repository

pull_request.title: Fixed duplicate `/assets` in Sentry stacktrace filenames
pull_request.body:
no issue

- For whatever reason, our Sentry stack traces are adding an extra `/assets` to the filenames in stacktraces from admin
- Attempted to fix this [here](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost/commit/3e9ee16ffb87bcf8e98c89a3213f8785fb8c19c0) but it didn't work because at this point the duplication hasn't occurred yet
- This change strips the `/assets` segment from the filenames, so when Sentry adds it back in, it doesn't duplicate anything. Would be good to get to the bottom of why this is happening, but this should hopefully improve our stacktraces in Sentry in the meantime.

commits.message:
Added console logs to debug Sentry stack traces in Admin (#18776)

no issue

- Our stack traces in Sentry are pointing to the wrong location for source code files. We attempted to fix this [here](https://github.com/TryGhost/Ghost/pull/18773) but this didn't work as expected in staging for some reason
- This commit just adds a few console logs to help with debugging in staging so we can figure out what's going wrong
